title: South African rand weakens before inflation data's release
text:
South African rand weakens before inflation data's release

Forex 3 hours ago (Oct 23, 2019 09:06)

© Reuters. South African rand weakens before inflation data's release JOHANNESBURG, Oct 23 (Reuters) - South Africa's rand weakened early on Wednesday, giving back some of the gains of from the day before, as investors took profits before a local inflation data release. Statistics South Africa publishes September inflation figures ZACPIY=ECI at 0800 GMT. Price growth is expected to remain benign, supporting the carry-trade attraction of the currency. At 0645 GMT, the rand ZAR=D3 was down 0.27% at 14.6290 per dollar, slipping from Tuesday's one-month best of 14.5700 reached during an emerging-market rally and easing fears around state power company Eskom. The crisis-hit utility got additional 59 billion rand ($4 billion) lifeline by parliament on Tuesday, after imposing another round of nationwide blackouts last week. were also weaker, with the yield on the benchmark government issue due in 2026 ZAR186= up 1 basis point to 8.215%

South African rand weakens before inflation data's release
description: South African rand weakens before inflation data's release
